member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildServerController
member.summary: Base type for the build server code. Contains the basic logic for running the actual server, startup and shutdown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildServerController.WasServerRunning(System.String)
member.summary: Was a server running with the specified session key during the execution of this call?

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildServerController.RunShutdownAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Shutting down the server is an inherently racy operation. The server can be started or stopped by external parties at any time.
This function will return success if at any time in the function the server is determined to no longer be running.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerHost.ClientDirectory
member.summary: Directory that contains the compiler executables and the response files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerHost.SdkDirectory
member.summary: Directory that contains mscorlib. Can be null when the host is executing in a CoreCLR context.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompletionReason.CompilationNotStarted
member.summary: There was an error creating the object and a compilation was never created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompletionReason.CompilationCompleted
member.summary: The compilation completed and results were provided to the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompletionReason.ClientDisconnect
member.summary: The compilation process was initiated and the client disconnected before the results could be provided to them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompletionReason.ClientException
member.summary: There was an unhandled exception processing the result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompletionReason.ClientShutdownRequest
member.summary: There was a request from the client to shutdown the server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ClientConnection
member.summary: Represents a single connection from a client process. Handles the named pipe from when the client connects to it, until the request is finished or abandoned. A new task is created to actually service the connection and do the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ClientConnection.CreateMonitorDisconnectTask(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns a Task that resolves if the client stream gets disconnected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ClientConnection.Close
member.summary: Close the connection. Can be called multiple times.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ClientConnection.CheckForNewKeepAlive(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildRequest)
member.summary: Check the request arguments for a new keep alive time. If one is present, set the server timer to the new time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.UpdateKeepAlive(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Called when the server updates the keep alive value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.ConnectionListening
member.summary: Called each time the server listens for new connections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.ConnectionReceived
member.summary: Called when a connection to the server occurs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.ConnectionCompleted(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when one or more connections have completed processing. The number of connections processed is provided in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.ConnectionRudelyEnded
member.summary: Called when a bad client connection was detected and the server will be shutting down as a result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.KeepAliveReached
member.summary: Called when the server is shutting down because the keep alive timeout was reached.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection
member.summary: Abstraction over the connection to the client process. This hides underlying connection to facilitate better testing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.LoggingIdentifier
member.summary: A value which can be used to identify this connection for logging purposes only. It has no guarantee of uniqueness.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.HandleConnection(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Server the connection and return the result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.Close
member.summary: Close the underlying client connection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.MemoryHelper
member.summary: Uses p/invoke to gain access to information about how much memory this process is using and how much is still available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.MetadataAndSymbolCache.GetUniqueFileKey(System.String)
member.summary:
A unique file key encapsulates a file path, and change date that can be used as the key to a dictionary. If a file hasn't changed name or timestamp, we assume it is unchanged.
Returns null if the file doesn't exist or otherwise can't be accessed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnectionHost.CreateListenTaskCore(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a Task that waits for a client connection to occur and returns the connected object. Throws on any connection error.
member.param: Used to cancel the connection sequence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnectionHost.ConstructPipe(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of the pipe. This might be the first instance, or a subsequent instance. There always needs to be an instance of the pipe created to listen for a new client connection.
member.returns: The pipe instance or throws an exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnection.CreateMonitorDisconnectTask(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
The IsConnected property on named pipes does not detect when the client has disconnected if we don't attempt any new I/O after the client disconnects. We start an async I/O here which serves to check the pipe for disconnection.
This will return true if the pipe was disconnected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnection.ClientAndOurIdentitiesMatch(System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream)
member.summary: Does the client of "pipeStream" have the same identity and elevation as we do?

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnection.GetIdentity(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return the current user name and whether the current user is in the administrator role.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher
member.summary: This class manages the connections, timeout and general scheduling of the client requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.State.Running
member.summary: Server running and accepting all requests

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.State.ShuttingDown
member.summary: Server processing existing requests, responding to shutdown commands but is not accepting new build requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.State.Completed
member.summary: Server is done.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.DefaultServerKeepAlive
member.summary: Default time the server will stay alive after the last request disconnects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.GCTimeout
member.summary: Time to delay after the last connection before initiating a garbage collection in the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.ListenAndDispatchConnections(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This function will accept and process new connections until an event causes the server to enter a passive shut down mode. For example if analyzers change or the keep alive timeout is hit. At which point this function will cease accepting new connections and wait for existing connections to complete before returning.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.WaitForAnyCompletion(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The server farms out work to Task values and this method needs to wait until at least one of them has completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.HandleCompletedConnections
member.summary: Checks the completed connection objects.
member.returns: False if the server needs to begin shutting down

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.HandleClientConnection(System.Threading.Tasks.Task{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection},System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a Task representing the processing of the new connection. This will return a task that will never fail. It will always produce a value. Connection errors will end up being represented as

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildClient
member.summary: Client class that handles communication to the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildClient.GetSystemSdkDirectory
member.summary: Returns the directory that contains mscorlib, or null when running on CoreCLR.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildClient.RunCompilation(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.BuildPaths,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Run a compilation through the compiler server and print the output to the console. If the compiler server fails, run the fallback compiler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildClient.RunServerCompilation(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.BuildPaths,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs the provided compilation on the server. If the compilation cannot be completed on the server then null will be returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildClient.GetCommandLineWindows(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
When running on Windows we can't take the command line which was provided to the Main method of the application. That will go through normal windows command line parsing which eliminates artifacts like quotes. This has the effect of normalizing the below command line options, which are semantically different, into the same value:
/reference:a,b /reference:"a,b"
To get the correct semantics here on Windows we parse the original command line provided to the process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildPathsAlt.ClientDirectory
member.summary: The path which contains the compiler binaries and response files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildPathsAlt.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: The path in which the compilation takes place.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildPathsAlt.SdkDirectory
member.summary: The path which contains mscorlib. This can be null when specified by the user or running in a CoreClr environment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildPathsAlt.TempDirectory
member.summary: The temporary directory a compilation should use instead of . The latter relies on global state individual compilations should ignore.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.IsCompilerServerSupported(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the compiler server is supported in this environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.TryCompile(System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeClientStream,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Try to compile using the server. Returns a null-containing Task if a response from the server cannot be retrieved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.CreateMonitorDisconnectTask(System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The IsConnected property on named pipes does not detect when the client has disconnected if we don't attempt any new I/O after the client disconnects. We start an async I/O here which serves to check the pipe for disconnection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.TryConnectToServerAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Connect to the pipe for a given directory and return it. Throws on cancellation.
member.param: Name of the named pipe to connect to.
Timeout to allow in connecting to process.
Cancellation token to cancel connection to server.
member.returns: An open to the server process or null on failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.CheckPipeConnectionOwnership(System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeClientStream)
member.summary: Check to ensure that the named pipe server we connected to is owned by the same user.
member.remarks: The type is embedded in assemblies that need to run cross platform. While this particular code will never be hit when running on non-Windows platforms it does need to work when on Windows. To facilitate that we use reflection to make the check here to enable it to compile into our cross plat assemblies.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.GetPipeNameForPathOpt(System.String)
member.returns: Null if not enough information was found to create a valid pipe name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.IsPipePathTooLong(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check if our constructed path is too long. On some Unix machines the pipe is a real file in the temp directory, and there is a limit on how long the path can be. This will never be true on Windows.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildServerConnection.GetTempPath(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the temporary path for the current environment assuming the working directory is . This function must emulate as closely as possible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.DesktopBuildClient.TimeoutOverride
member.summary: When set it overrides all timeout values in milliseconds when communicating with the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.DesktopBuildClient.TryCreateServer(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the server process, returning true on success and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.DesktopBuildClient.GetSessionKey(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.BuildPaths)
member.summary: Given the full path to the directory containing the compiler exes, retrieves the name of the pipe for client/server communication on that instance of the compiler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.ExitingTraceListener
member.summary: This trace listener is useful in environments where we don't want a dialog but instead want to exit with a reliable stack trace of the failure. For example during a bootstrap build where the assert dialog would otherwise cause a Jenkins build to timeout.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildRequest
member.summary:
Represents a request from the client. A request is as follows.
Field Name Type Size (bytes) ---------------------------------------------------- Length Integer 4 Language RequestLanguage 4 Argument Count UInteger 4 Arguments Argument[] Variable
See for the format of an Argument.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildRequest.ReadAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Read a Request from the given stream.
The total request size must be less than 1MB.
member.returns: null if the Request was too large, the Request otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildRequest.WriteAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Write a Request to the stream.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildRequest.Argument
member.summary:
A command line argument to the compilation. An argument is formatted as follows:
Field Name Type Size (bytes) -------------------------------------------------- ID UInteger 4 Index UInteger 4 Value String Variable
Strings are encoded via a length prefix as a signed 32-bit integer, followed by an array of characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildResponse
member.summary:
Base class for all possible responses to a request. The ResponseType enum should list all possible response types and ReadResponse creates the appropriate response subclass based on the response type sent by the client. The format of a response is:
Field Name Field Type Size (bytes) ------------------------------------------------- responseLength int (positive) 4 responseType enum ResponseType 4 responseBody Response subclass variable

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildResponse.ReadAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: May throw exceptions if there are pipe problems.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompletedBuildResponse
member.summary:
Represents a Response from the server. A response is as follows.
Field Name Type Size (bytes) -------------------------------------------------- Length UInteger 4 ReturnCode Integer 4 Output String Variable ErrorOutput String Variable
Strings are encoded via a character count prefix as a 32-bit integer, followed by an array of characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.MismatchedVersionBuildResponse.AddResponseBody(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: MismatchedVersion has no body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.AnalyzerInconsistencyBuildResponse.AddResponseBody(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: AnalyzerInconsistency has no body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.RejectedBuildResponse.AddResponseBody(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: AnalyzerInconsistency has no body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildProtocolConstants

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildProtocolConstants.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: The version number for this protocol.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildProtocolConstants.ReadLengthPrefixedString(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Read a string from the Reader where the string is encoded as a length prefix (signed 32-bit integer) followed by a sequence of characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildProtocolConstants.WriteLengthPrefixedString(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Write a string to the Writer where the string is encoded as a length prefix (signed 32-bit integer) follows by a sequence of characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.BuildProtocolConstants.ReadAllAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This task does not complete until we are completely done reading.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.ConsoleUtil.RunWithUtf8Output``1(System.Func{System.IO.TextWriter,``0})
member.summary: This will update the value to have UTF8 encoding for the duration of the provided call back. The newly created will be passed down to the callback.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.NativeMethods
member.summary: Interop methods.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompilerServerLogger
member.summary: Class for logging information about what happens in the server and client parts of the Roslyn command line compiler and build tasks. Useful for debugging what is going on.
member.remarks: To use the logging, set the environment variable RoslynCommandLineLogFile to the name of a file to log to. This file is logged to by both client and server components.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompilerServerLogger.#cctor
member.summary: Static class initializer that initializes logging.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompilerServerLogger.Initialize(System.String)
member.summary: Set the logging prefix that describes our role. Typically a 3-letter abbreviation. If logging happens before this, it's logged with "---".

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompilerServerLogger.LogException(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: Log an exception. Also logs information about inner exceptions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompilerServerLogger.Log(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a line of text to the logging file, with string.Format arguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompilerServerLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Log a line of text to the logging file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLine.CompilerServerLogger.GetLoggingPrefix
member.summary: Get the string that prefixes all log entries. Shows the process, thread, and time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ShadowCopyAnalyzerAssemblyLoader._baseDirectory
member.summary: The base directory for shadow copies. Each instance of gets its own subdirectory under this directory. This is also the starting point for scavenge operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ShadowCopyAnalyzerAssemblyLoader._shadowCopyDirectoryAndMutex
member.summary: The directory where this instance of will shadow-copy assemblies, and the mutex created to mark that the owner of it is still active.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ShadowCopyAnalyzerAssemblyLoader._assemblyDirectoryId
member.summary: Used to generate unique names for per-assembly directories. Should be updated with .
